SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
DATA CLOUD
Link Core Activations to the Marketing Cloud Engagement Contact Model

Data specialists perform these steps in Marketing Cloud Engagement to establish the data foundation.

Create attribute groups in Contact Builder.
IMPLEMENTATION PATTERN	EXAMPLE ATTRIBUTE GROUPS
Core Audience Model	
SF CDP

Collective Core Audience model	
Identity & Consent
Subscriptions & Preferences
Demographics & Psychographics
Ecommerce
In each attribute group, data specialists link the data extensions that marketers activated in Data Cloud.
Ensure that the data deletion feature is turned off for the commonly shared data extensions.
Relate the Individual data extensions with a 1:1 relationship to the root on ContactKey↔Individual ID.
Link the activated Unified Individual data extensions directly to the Individual data extension in a 1:1 relationship Individual ID↔Individual ID.
IMPLEMENTATION PATTERN	EXAMPLE ATTRIBUTE GROUPS	EXAMPLE DATA EXTENSIONS IN THE ATTRIBUTE GROUPS
Core Audience Model	
SF CDP
	
MC Core All

Collective Core Audience model	
Identity & Consent
Subscriptions & Preferences
Demographics & Psychographics
Ecommerce
	
MC Identity & Consent
MC Subscriptions & Preferences
MC Demographics & Psychographics
MC ecommerce
In Marketing Cloud Engagement, create a Contact Model attribute group for ad hoc campaigns.
NOTE To prevent data sprawl and performance impacts, turn on the data deletion feature only for the ad hoc data extensions so that their stored data is deleted after the journey is complete. It’s also best practice to routinely check and delete old data extensions from the Contact Model.
